meanings.definition: To set a new price for something.
meanings.sent1: I am repricing my old books to sell them at a higher price.
meanings.sent2: The store is repricing their products for the upcoming sale.
meanings.sent3: After repricing the items, the shopkeeper realized they were now too expensive for the budget shoppers.
meanings.sent4: She felt like repricing her artwork was akin to putting a fresh coat of paint on an old masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The process of repricing the vintage furniture made the pieces look brand new.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the price of something.
meanings.sent1: The repricing of the concert tickets caused confusion among the fans.
meanings.sent2: We had to do a repricing of the products due to the sudden increase in production costs.
meanings.sent3: The repricing of the movie tickets led to a rush of people trying to grab the discounted seats.
meanings.sent4: The repricing of the house felt like rearranging the pieces of a puzzle to fit a new picture.
meanings.sent5: The sudden repricing of the rare stamps caught the attention of collectors worldwide.
